attractions.name: Tivoli Gardens
attractions.description: One of the world's oldest amusement parks that inspired Walt Disney, featuring over two dozen rides, lush gardens, and old-world charm in the heart of Copenhagen. The park hosts seasonal celebrations including Halloween and Christmas markets with themed decorations.
attractions.opening_hours: Monday-Thursday: 11:00 AM - 10:00 PM, Friday-Saturday: 11:00 AM - 12:00 AM, Sunday: 11:00 AM - 10:00 PM
attractions.best_time: Evening for illuminated atmosphere; seasonal visits for themed decorations
attractions.website: Available through Copenhagen Card for discounts

attractions.name: Nyhavn (New Harbor)
attractions.description: Picturesque 17th-century waterfront district with colorful buildings, historic canal, cobblestone streets, and tall ships. Essential Copenhagen classic perfect for leisurely strolls and canal tours.
attractions.entry_fee: Free to explore; canal tours extra
attractions.duration: 1-2 hours for walking, 1 hour for canal tours
attractions.best_time: Summer for outdoor dining and pier activities

attractions.name: Amalienborg Palace
attractions.description: The Queen's residence consisting of four rococo palaces around a square, featuring royal history museum and daily changing of the guard at 12 noon. Two palaces are open to the public showcasing 400 years of royal history.
attractions.entry_fee: Museum entry required for interior tours

attractions.name: The Little Mermaid Statue
attractions.description: Copenhagen's iconic symbol inspired by Hans Christian Andersen's fairy tale, representing Denmark's most famous cultural export. Essential for first-time visitors despite its modest size.
attractions.best_time: Early morning or sunset for fewer crowds

attractions.name: Rosenborg Castle
attractions.description: Historic Renaissance castle built 1606-34 featuring Danish crown jewels, royal history, and beautiful gardens including the famous rose garden. Houses significant cultural treasures in basement vaults.

restaurants.name: Geranium
restaurants.description: The only three-star Michelin restaurant in Denmark, run by world's best chef 2011 Rasmus Kofoed, located on 8th floor overlooking Fælledparken. Offers innovative Nordic cuisine with spectacular city views.

restaurants.name: noma
restaurants.description: Restaurant that revolutionized Danish gastronomy and launched the New Nordic movement, featuring innovative use of local ingredients and fermentation techniques. Opened by René Redzepi in 2003.

restaurants.name: Ida Davidsen
restaurants.description: 4th generation smørrebrød specialist operating since 1888, famous for having one of Denmark's most extensive smørrebrød menus. Family reputation for authentic preparation.

bars.name: ROOF CPH
bars.description: Extraordinary rooftop bar atop NH Collection Copenhagen offering breathtaking city skyline views, waterfront vistas, and iconic mint-green rooftops. Serves flavourful cocktails and exquisite food.

bars.name: Mikkeller Venues
bars.description: Copenhagen's craft brewery pioneer offering unique flavor profiles from chocolate to chili with higher alcohol content than expected. Multiple locations across the city.

activities.activity: Nyhavn walking tour and canal cruise (2-3 hours)
Amalienborg Palace with guard ceremony at noon
The Round Tower and city views
Marv & Ben for New Nordic experience
Local bistro or Beyla for vegan option

transportation: Copenhagen Card: Unlimited public transport plus free entry to 80+ attractions
DOT Tickets App: Primary mobile ticketing for metro, bus, and trains
Zones: City divided into fare zones; 3-zone ticket covers airport to city center (DKK 36)
cultural_tips: Tipping: Service included; round up for exceptional service
Fika Culture: Coffee and pastry breaks are important social time
Hygge: Embrace cozy, comfortable social atmosphere

attractions.name: Gamla Stan (Old Town)
attractions.description: Stockholm's oldest district dating back to Middle Ages, featuring narrow cobblestone streets, colorful buildings, and living museum atmosphere. Contains Royal Palace, Stockholm Cathedral, and Medieval Museum.
attractions.entry_fee: Free to explore; attractions charge separately
attractions.best_time: Morning or late afternoon for optimal lighting

attractions.name: Vasa Museum
attractions.description: Remarkable 17th-century warship that capsized in 1628 and was recovered 333 years later. Features 11 exhibition areas including crew skeletons, ship artifacts, and salvaging equipment.

attractions.name: Skansen Open-Air Museum
attractions.description: World's oldest open-air museum featuring 150 buildings from across Sweden, traditional craftspeople, Nordic wildlife including bears and moose. Living history across 75 acres.
attractions.best_time: Summer for full programming and weather

attractions.name: Royal Palace (Kungliga Slottet)
attractions.description: One of Europe's largest palaces featuring 600+ rooms, royal apartments, museums, and daily guard ceremonies. Active royal residence with public areas.

attractions.name: Fotografiska
attractions.description: Vital center for contemporary photography featuring world-renowned exhibitions in stunning waterfront location. Popular meeting point with excellent views.
attractions.best_time: Late afternoon for photography and views

restaurants.name: Frantzén
restaurants.description: Sweden's first three-star Michelin restaurant located in renovated 19th-century townhouse where diners change rooms and floors throughout innovative menu experience. Historic achievement for Swedish gastronomy.

restaurants.name: AIRA
restaurants.description: Seasonal Nordic flavors and ingredients in beautiful Djurgården Island setting overlooking the sea. Head chef Tommy Myllymäki created destination worth detour, receiving second star in 2023.

restaurants.name: Ekstedt
restaurants.description: Niklas Ekstedt's vision of Nordic cuisine using only open fire, wood, and smoke for cooking. Unique approach eliminating modern kitchen technology.

bars.name: Freyja Söder
bars.description: Latest addition to Stockholm's rooftop scene combining Scandinavian elegance indoors with outdoor bar featuring graffiti, grilled sausages, well-made cocktails, and panoramic views.

bars.name: Berns
bars.description: Stockholm's oldest nightlife institution entertaining the city since 1863 with live music, clubs, and ballroom parties.
bars.dress_code: Smart casual to dressy depending on event

activities.activity: Traditional Swedish café in Old Town
Royal Palace tour with guard ceremony
Classic club experience at Berns or Trädgården

transportation: SL App: Official Stockholm public transport app for journey planning and mobile tickets
Contactless Payment: Works on buses and trains for tourists without Swedish cards
Public Transport: Comprehensive metro, bus, and boat connections
cultural_tips: Fika: Coffee and cake culture essential to Swedish social life
Alcohol: Systembolaget state monopoly for alcohol over 3.5%; restaurants and bars more expensive
Tipping: Not expected; round up for good service

seasonal_considerations.summer: Best weather, outdoor dining, rooftop bars fully operational, longer daylight
seasonal_considerations.winter: Christmas markets, cozy indoor venues, limited rooftop access
seasonal_considerations.spring_fall: Moderate crowds, variable weather, ideal for museums and indoor attractions

weather_alternatives.rainy: Museums (Vasa, Fotografiska), covered markets, traditional cafés, indoor venues
weather_alternatives.clear: Rooftop bars, walking tours, outdoor markets, island visits
weather_alternatives.winter: Christmas markets, cozy wine bars, thermal baths, indoor cultural venues
